   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: -module(ssl_engine_SUITE).
   23: 
   24: -behaviour(ct_suite).
   25: 
   26: -include("ssl_test_lib.hrl").
   27: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   28: -include_lib("public_key/include/public_key.hrl").
   29: 
   30: %% Common test
   31: -export([all/0,
   32:          init_per_suite/1,
   33:          init_per_testcase/2,
   34:          end_per_suite/1,
   35:          end_per_testcase/2
   36:         ]).
   37: %% Test cases
   38: -export([private_key/1
   39:         ]).
   40: 
   41: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   42: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
   43: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   44: all() ->
   45:     [
   46:      private_key
   47:     ].
   48: 
   49: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   50:     catch crypto:stop(),
   51:     try crypto:start() of
   52: 	ok ->
   53:             case crypto:info_lib() of
   54:                 [{_,_, <<"OpenSSL 1.0.1s-freebsd  1 Mar 2016">>}] ->
   55:                     {skip, "Problem with engine on OpenSSL 1.0.1s-freebsd"};
   56:                 _ ->
   57:                     ssl_test_lib:clean_start(),
   58:                     case crypto:get_test_engine() of
   59:                          {ok, EngineName} ->
   60:                             try
   61:                                 %% The test engine has it's own fake rsa sign/verify that
   62:                                 %% you don't want to use, so exclude it from methods to load:
   63:                                 Methods = 
   64:                                     crypto:engine_get_all_methods() -- [engine_method_rsa],
   65:                                 crypto:engine_load(<<"dynamic">>,
   66:                                                    [{<<"SO_PATH">>, EngineName},
   67:                                                     <<"LOAD">>],
   68:                                                    [],
   69:                                                    Methods)
   70:                             of
   71:                                 {ok, Engine} ->
   72:                                     [{engine, Engine} |Config];
   73:                                 {error, Reason} ->
   74:                                     ?CT_PAL("Reason ~p", [Reason]),
   75:                                     {skip, "No dynamic engine support"}
   76:                             catch error:notsup ->
   77:                                     {skip, "No engine support in OpenSSL"}    
   78:                             end;
   79:                         {error, notexist} ->
   80:                             {skip, "Test engine not found"}
   81:                     end
   82:             end
   83:     catch _:_ ->
   84: 	    {skip, "Crypto did not start"}
   85:     end.
   86: 
   87: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   88:     Engine = proplists:get_value(engine, Config),
   89:     crypto:engine_unload(Engine),
   90:     ssl:stop(),
   91:     application:stop(crypto).
   92: 
   93: 
   94: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   95:     ssl:stop(),
   96:     ssl:start(),
   97:     ssl_test_lib:ct_log_supported_protocol_versions(Config),
   98:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
   99:     Config.
  100: 
  101: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->     
  102:     Config.
  103: 
  104: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  105: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  106: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  107: 
  108: private_key(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  109:     ClientFileBase = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "client_engine"]),
  110:     ServerFileBase = filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "server_engine"]),
  111:     Ext = x509_test:extensions([{key_usage, [digitalSignature, keyEncipherment]}]),
  112:     #{server_config := ServerConf,
  113:       client_config := ClientConf} = GenCertData =
  114:         public_key:pkix_test_data(#{server_chain => 
  115:                                         #{root => [{digest, sha256},
  116:                                                    {key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(1)}],
  117:                                           intermediates => [[{digest, sha256},
  118:                                                             {key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(2)}]],
  119:                                           peer => [{extensions, Ext}, {digest, sha256},
  120:                                                    {key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(3)}
  121:                                                   ]},
  122:                                     client_chain => 
  123:                                       #{root => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(4)}, {digest, sha256}],
  124:                                         intermediates => [[{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(5)},
  125:                                                              {digest, sha256}]],
  126:                                           peer => [{key, ssl_test_lib:hardcode_rsa_key(6)},{digest, sha256}]}}),
  127:     [{server_config, FileServerConf}, 
  128:      {client_config, FileClientConf}] = 
  129:         x509_test:gen_pem_config_files(GenCertData, ClientFileBase, ServerFileBase),
  130:     
  131:     Engine = proplists:get_value(engine, Config),
  132: 
  133:     ClientKey = engine_key(FileClientConf),
  134:     ServerKey = engine_key(FileServerConf),
  135: 
  136:     EngineClientConf = [{key, #{algorithm => rsa,
  137:                                 engine => Engine,
  138:                                 key_id => ClientKey}} | proplists:delete(key, ClientConf)],
  139:     
  140:     EngineServerConf = [{key, #{algorithm => rsa,
  141:                                 engine => Engine,
  142:                                 key_id => ServerKey}} | proplists:delete(key, ServerConf)],
  143: 
  144:     EngineFileClientConf = [{key, #{algorithm => rsa,
  145:                                     engine => Engine,
  146:                                     key_id => ClientKey}} | 
  147:                             proplists:delete(keyfile, FileClientConf)],
  148:     
  149:     EngineFileServerConf = [{key, #{algorithm => rsa,
  150:                                     engine => Engine,
  151:                                     key_id => ServerKey}} | 
  152:                             proplists:delete(keyfile, FileServerConf)],
  153: 
  154:     %% Test with engine
  155:     test_tls_connection(EngineServerConf, EngineClientConf, Config),
  156:     
  157:     %% Test with engine and rsa keyexchange
  158:     RSASuites = all_kex_rsa_suites([{tls_version, 'tlsv1.2'} | Config]),
  159:     
  160:     test_tls_connection([{ciphers, RSASuites}, {versions, ['tlsv1.2']} | EngineServerConf], 
  161:                         [{ciphers, RSASuites}, {versions, ['tlsv1.2']} | EngineClientConf], Config),
  162:     
  163:     %% Test with engine and present file arguments
  164:     test_tls_connection(EngineFileServerConf, EngineFileClientConf, Config),
  165:     
  166:     %% Test that software fallback is available
  167:     test_tls_connection(ServerConf, [{reuse_sessions, false} |ClientConf], Config).
  168:     
  169: engine_key(Conf) ->
  170:     FileStr = proplists:get_value(keyfile, Conf),
  171:     list_to_binary(FileStr).
  172:     
  173: 
  174: test_tls_connection(ServerConf, ClientConf, Config) ->
  175:     {ClientNode, ServerNode, Hostname} = ssl_test_lib:run_where(Config),
  176:     
  177:     Server = ssl_test_lib:start_server([{node, ServerNode}, {port, 0},
  178: 					{from, self()},
  179:                                         {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  180:                                         {options, [{verify, verify_peer}
  181:                                                    | ServerConf]}]),
  182:     Port  = ssl_test_lib:inet_port(Server),
  183:     Client = ssl_test_lib:start_client([{node, ClientNode}, {port, Port},
  184: 					{host, Hostname},
  185:                                         {from, self()},
  186:                                         {mfa, {ssl_test_lib, send_recv_result_active, []}},
  187:                                         {options,  [{verify, verify_peer} | ClientConf]}]),
  188:     
  189:     ssl_test_lib:check_result(Server, ok, Client, ok),
  190:     ssl_test_lib:close(Server),
  191:     ssl_test_lib:close(Client).
  192: 
  193: all_kex_rsa_suites(Config) ->
  194:     Version = proplists:get_value(tls_version, Config),
  195:     All = ssl:cipher_suites(all, Version),
  196:     ssl:filter_cipher_suites(All,[{key_exchange, fun(rsa) -> true;(_) -> false end}]).
